sentences: Tal on võti oma korteri ees.
Kas sa võiksid mulle anda võti?
context: The word 'võtit' is the partitive case form of the Estonian noun 'võti', which means 'key'. In Estonian, nouns change their endings based on grammatical cases. The partitive case (ending -it/-id) typically indicates that something is being referred to in an incomplete or unspecified manner, or as a direct object. So 'võtit' would translate to '(a) key' in English when used as the direct object of a verb.
